justification: “Higher levels of EEG-Engagement are proposed to positively correlate with higher levels of attention, task demand, and/or cognitive demand.”
“Increased levels of EEG-Workload are proposed to positively correlate with higher levels of executive function, task demand, and working memory load arising from complex cognitive tasks.”
The text notes that EEG-Workload “positively correlate[s] with… working memory load arising from complex cognitive tasks.”
Neurophysiologic Synchronies are defined as “a group- or team-level measure… thought to reflect how synchronized the team is as a whole and positively correlates with higher team performance.”
“Cognitive readiness is associated with the phase of alpha oscillations, which predicts whether incoming sensory information will be efficiently processed.”
The authors state that “cognitive alertness is linked to EEG markers that capture the widespread increase in alpha power (i.e., across the scalp).”
